item.title: Environment Variables From Env File in Nextjs
item.description: If you started building your application with next and you want it to access environment variables in your .env file here is away. Why you need a .env file There are a number of reasons why you should have a .env file when working on an application, they are: * Security: A .env file can be used to store critical and sensitive credentials such as access_tokens, secret_keys or api_keys thus ensuring they are not exploited by a hacker prying on your repo.
